[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Product Distribution System (PDS) defines requirements for inventory management  sales transactions  and financial reporting.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: PDS provides a point-of-sale (POS) system for cashiers  and a management dashboard for business insights.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: PDS supports barcode scanners  receipt printers  and touchscreen terminals.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: PDS uses PostgreSQL for data storage  REST APIs for transaction management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: PDS secures sales transactions via TLS encryption.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: PDS optimizes data handling for high-volume transactions and real-time updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: PDS handles inventory synchronization  sales tracking  financial reporting.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: PDS is configurable for single and multi-location retail businesses.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: PDS integrates with tax authorities  audit logs  and business reporting tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 MISSING-TAG2: PDS integrates with payment gateways  tax systems  and inventory management databases.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: PDS supports product catalog updates  sales processing  receipt generation  and business reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: PDS manages product inventory  sales transactions  receipt generation  reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Requires internet connectivity for real-time inventory updates and financial reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: PDS relies on real-time stock levels  secure payment processing  tax compliance systems.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 MISSING-TAG1: Designed for cashiers  store managers  finance teams managing transactions and reporting.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow managers to update product details  pricing  stock levels  discounts (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall require cashier authentication before sales  allowing scanning  payments  receipt printing (REQ-DB-001  REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall log all transactions  including product details  payments  cashier ID  VAT (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process sales in 3 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a cashier interface with barcode scanning  search  error handling.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store product details  pricing  stock levels  categories.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall store transactions  including product details  payments  timestamps  receipts.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support real-time inventory synchronization.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with tax regulations  transaction security  reporting standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log updates  transactions  refunds  cashier activity.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with inventory databases to sync product details.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect with tax authorities for VAT compliance.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests product updates, barcode scanning, sales, VAT compliance, and audit logs.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and tax compliance manuals.
[SEC] 5. References: Retail compliance policies, tax regulations, and financial reporting standards.
